intro: Cotula atrata, commonly known as the dark cotula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive dark green color, while its flowers range from white to pale yellow. Cotula atrata is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
